TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Notice My Bug Report, Senpai" Edition

Articles.Content: At least the What-not-to-suggest-list lists "Kerbal cemetaries and such" as "* will not be in (first release of) the game" and gives a mod for it.
That's a weird spot to place a cemetery, though, isn't it? How can you rest in peace with planes taking off and landing a few feet away from your grave?
I'm sure Kerbals would only be able to rest in peace with the roaring of jets and rockets next to their grave...

It HAS to be deformable terrain, because good players rarely crash?

I really wish the kids who think it's deformable terrain/destructible buildings would sober up. Squad hasn't even given us a way to financially recover dropped stages, they're not giving us deformation physics. Especially in a build that seems to be running ahead of schedule.
"Hey guys, we know we haven't even given you clouds yet, or water physics, or real aerodynamics, or even rocket damage beyond vague *pop*s, but here's DEFORMABLE TERRAIN AND DESTRUCTIBLE BUILDINGS!"

That's a weird spot to place a cemetery, though, isn't it? How can you rest in peace with planes taking off and landing a few feet away from your grave?

For me at least, it would greatly reduce the transport costs. Most of the kerbals I kill these days are at the West end of the runway.

"Hey guys, we know we haven't even given you clouds yet, or water physics, or real aerodynamics, or even rocket damage beyond vague *pop*s, but here's DEFORMABLE TERRAIN AND DESTRUCTIBLE BUILDINGS!"

There's a problem with that argument. YOu could splice about 100 things they HAVE put in the game and it sounds just as ridiculous.

...asteroids that slow down so much in atmo that they land on their own!

...a soccer ball!

...a bumpier Mun!

...Biomes! On planets that can't support life!

...right-clicky science!

...nosecones that increase drag!

...etc etc etc.

I really wish the kids who think it's deformable terrain/destructible buildings would sober up. Squad hasn't even given us a way to financially recover dropped stages, they're not giving us deformation physics. Especially in a build that seems to be running ahead of schedule.

I can't believe you thought I was being literal. We all know that the CPU would disintegrate the instant a rocket were to crash into the ground...

There's a problem with that argument. YOu could splice about 100 things they HAVE put in the game and it sounds just as ridiculous.

...asteroids that slow down so much in atmo that they land on their own!

...a soccer ball!

...a bumpier Mun!

...Biomes! On planets that can't support life!

...right-clicky science!

...nosecones that increase drag!

...etc etc etc.

Are you suggesting they're planning on a secret element and it'll be so poorly polished that we'll get deformable terrain and/or destructible buildings by accident?

edit: And I wasn't targeting you specifically with that post, Rthsom. Just as a cue on that particular running belief in general.

Edited September 11, 2014 by Franklin

edit: And I wasn't targeting you specifically with that post, Rthsom. Just as a cue on that particular running belief in general.

No problem. The devs have enough things to fix or add to the game, no need for laggy, useless (but it would be pretty cool ) things like deformable terrain yet.

"Hasn't been attempted by a mod before"

Ah, thank you for clarifying.

Oh well, me being hopeful. Weather or craters sounds pretty awesome though.

Are you suggesting they're planning on a secret element and it'll be so poorly polished that we'll get deformable terrain and/or destructible buildings by accident

Not at all. Every one of the things I listed were put in - as far as I know - completely and totally on purpose by Squad.

Not at all. Every one of the things I listed were put in - as far as I know - completely and totally on purpose by Squad.

What was it you listed?

What was it you listed?
See post #157

My guess is end-of-mission cinematics or something similar. For this update they'll just do the funerals/memorials for deceased kerbals. Later updates will do the ticker-tape parades welcoming home their spaceship-jockey heroes.
My guess is something dull like bank loans.

See post #157

My guess is end-of-mission cinematics or something similar. For this update they'll just do the funerals/memorials for deceased kerbals. Later updates will do the ticker-tape parades welcoming home their spaceship-jockey heroes.

Ah. Well okay then . If you put it that way
Wouldja believe...cargo bay loans?

My guess is end-of-mission cinematics or something similar. For this update they'll just do the funerals/memorials for deceased kerbals. Later updates will do the ticker-tape parades welcoming home their spaceship-jockey heroes.

So, cutscenes, yes?

Well, the art department must have petitioned for more screentime for their work?
Maybe launching commercial satellites for money?

Maybe launching commercial satellites for money?

So, good players won't see it, because they do not need to rent their rockets to a third party? Naaah ...

My guess is something dull like bank loans.

Except apparently it's also fun to do again and again..

So, cutscenes, yes?

Well, the art department must have petitioned for more screentime for their work?

Not just cutscenes: "Procedurally Generated Cutscenes".

I would love to see that.
Was "the biggest arts asset" already revealed or is it still a criteria for our investigation?

So, good players won't see it, because they do not need to rent their rockets to a third party? Naaah ...

Alternatively, it could be deep sea assets. Nobody has ever done exploring underwater before.

- "the biggest arts asset"

- Harvester had fun doing it over and over again

- good players will probably never see it

And there was a mod that enabled you to controllably (??) submerge and surface submarines/crafts.
